alert.note: Alert for Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; James City; Lancaster; Mathews; Middlesex; Northumberland; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 3:54PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Gloucester, Middlesex, southeastern King and Queen, Northumberland, northwestern York, northwestern Mathews, northeastern James City and Lancaster Counties and the City of Williamsburg through 445 PM EDT... At 354 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Shacklefords to near Barhamsville to near Norge. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Williamsburg, Gloucester Courthouse, West Point, Kilmarnock, Urbanna, Fair Port, Norge, Deltaville, College Of William And Mary, Lancaster, White Stone, Saluda, Wicomico Church, Jamaica, Church View, Hartfield, Glenns, Blakes, Shacklefords and Byrdton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern, southeastern and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; James City; Lancaster; Mathews; Middlesex; Northumberland; York
